sentence.Network_en: The governor was forced to parley with the rebels.
sentence.Network_cn: 州长被迫与反叛者谈判.

sentence.Network_en: The government is ready to hold a parley at any moment.
The general held a parley with the enemy about exchanging prisoners.
sentence.Network_cn: 将军与敌人谈判交换战俘事宜.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting speech or debate): perhaps from Old French parlee 'spoken', feminine past participle of the verb parler

entry.def: A parley is a discussion between two opposing people or groups in which both sides try to come to an agreement.
When two opposing people or groups parley, they meet to discuss something in order to come to an agreement.

example.ex: ...a place where we meet and parley...
I don't think you've ever tried parleying with Gleed, have you?
example.tran: 我想你没有尝试和格利德谈和过，是吗？
